subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Sunday, 10 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Real chief wants Beckham to stay
Real Madrid president Ramon Calderon hopes he can persuade LA Galaxy-bound David Beckham to stay.



 
Wenger pledges to honour contract
Manager Arsene Wenger says he will be at Arsenal next season but he stops short of committing his long-term future to the club.



 
U21s need full-time boss - Pearce
Stuart Pearce says his problems in the lead up to European U21 championships justify the need for a full-time coach.








GOLF




Montgomerie parts with his caddie
Colin Montgomerie splits with caddie Alastair McLean just days before the US Open at Oakmont.



 
BA-CA Open leaderboard
Score updates from the final round of the European Tour event in Vienna.



 
Scott maintains St Jude pressure
Australia's Adam Scott surges to a three-shot lead heading into the final round of the St Jude Championship.








MOTORSPORT




Live - Canadian Grand Prix
McLaren's Lewis Hamilton goes in search of his first Formula One win as he starts from pole position in Montreal.



 
Stoner wins epic Catalunya battle
Casey Stoner edges out Valentino Rossi to win a thrilling Catalunya MotoGP.



 
Hamilton takes pole for Canada GP
McLaren sensation Lewis Hamilton secures the first pole position of his Formula One career in Montreal.








FORMULA ONE




Live - Canadian Grand Prix
McLaren's Lewis Hamilton goes in search of his first Formula One win as he starts from pole position in Montreal.



 
Hamilton takes pole for Canada GP
McLaren sensation Lewis Hamilton secures the first pole position of his Formula One career in Montreal.



 
Canadian qualifying as it happened
Lewis Hamilton claims his first pole position with a stunning final lap in qualifying for the Canadian GP.








ATHLETICS




Gillick sets new Irish 400m mark
David Gillick smashes the Irish 400m record at Switzerland's Atletica Geneve meeting.



 
Devonish delivers relay warning
Marlon Devonish says Britain should avoid rushing its next batch of sprint talent into the senior international arena.



 
British duo claim wins in Turin
Tim Benjamin wins the 400m and Marlon Devonish the 100m at Friday's meeting in Turin.








CYCLING




Wiggins wins Dauphine time-trial
Britain's Bradley Wiggins gives his Tour de France prospects a boost by winning the prologue in the Dauphine Libere.



 
Tour takes Riis off winners list
Tour de France organisers say they no longer consider Bjarne Riis the 1996 race winner after his drugs confession.



 
Belgian police make doping raids
An assistant from Belgian cycling team Quick-Step is questioned after a series of drugs raids.








FUN AND GAMES




Comment: Becks for good
Robbo on Beckham's return for England



 
Ramprakash goes dancing again
Strictly Come Dancing star Mark Ramprakash breaks out a few of his best moves ahead of Surrey's Twenty20 campaign this summer.



 
Hatton gets new nickname
Boxer changing his name to the 'Manchester Mexican'
